recipes.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.summary: Spaghetti Carbonara is a classic Italian pasta dish from Rome made with eggs, hard cheese, cured pork, and black pepper. It's simple to make with just a few ingredients, and is ready in under 30 minutes.
recipes.instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the spaghetti and cook until al dente, about 8-10 minutes.
2. While the pasta is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook until crispy, about 5-7 minutes. If using garlic, add it during the last minute of cooking.
3. In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper.
4. When the pasta is done, reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta water, then drain the pasta.
5. Working quickly, add the hot pasta to the skillet with the pancetta. Remove from heat.
6. Pour the egg mixture over the pasta and toss quickly to combine. The heat from the pasta will cook the eggs and create a creamy sauce. If the sauce is too thick, add a splash of the reserved pasta water.
7. Season with salt to taste and serve immediately with additional Parmesan cheese and black pepper.

recipes.title: Vegetable Stir Fry
recipes.summary: This quick and healthy vegetable stir fry is loaded with colorful vegetables and a savory sauce. It's perfect for a weeknight dinner and can be customized with your favorite vegetables or protein.

extendedIngredients.name: soy sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 3 tbsp low-sodium soy sauce or tamari

extendedIngredients.name: cornstarch
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water

recipes.instructions:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
2. Add the garlic and ginger and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
3. Add the broccoli and carrots and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
4. Add the bell peppers, snow peas, and mushrooms. Continue to stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
5. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, sesame oil, and cornstarch mixture.
6. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir to coat. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until the sauce thickens.
7. Serve hot over cooked rice.

recipes.title: Chicken and Vegetable Stir Fry
recipes.summary: This quick and healthy stir fry combines tender chicken with colorful vegetables in a savory sauce. It's perfect for a weeknight dinner and ready in just 25 minutes.

extendedIngredients.name: chicken breast
extendedIngredients.original: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into thin strips

extendedIngredients.name: soy sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 3 tbsp low-sodium soy sauce or tamari

extendedIngredients.name: cornstarch
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water

recipes.instructions:
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
2. Add the chicken strips and stir-fry for 4-5 minutes until no longer pink. Remove from the wok and set aside.
3. Add the remaining tablespoon of oil to the wok. Add the garlic and ginger and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
4. Add the broccoli and carrots and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
5. Add the bell peppers and continue to stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
6. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, and cornstarch mixture.
7. Return the chicken to the wok with the vegetables. Pour the sauce over everything and stir to coat. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until the sauce thickens.
8. Serve hot over cooked rice.

recipes.title: Vegetable Pasta Primavera
recipes.summary: A light and flavorful pasta dish loaded with seasonal vegetables and herbs. This vegetarian pasta primavera is perfect for spring and summer.

extendedIngredients.name: asparagus
extendedIngredients.original: 1 bunch asparagus, trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: parmesan cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for serving

recipes.instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining.
2. While pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
3. Add bell peppers, zucchini, yellow squash, and asparagus. Cook for 4-5 minutes until vegetables begin to soften.
4. Add cherry tomatoes and peas. Cook for another 2 minutes.
5. Reduce heat to low and add the drained pasta to the skillet with the vegetables.
6. Add Parmesan cheese, heavy cream, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Toss to combine. If the sauce is too thick, add some of the reserved pasta water.
7. Stir in fresh basil and season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve immediately with additional Parmesan cheese on top.

recipes.title: Vegetable Frittata
recipes.summary: An Italian egg dish filled with colorful vegetables and cheese, perfect for breakfast or brunch. This versatile dish can be customized with your favorite vegetables.

extendedIngredients.name: fresh herbs
extendedIngredients.original: 2 tbsp fresh herbs (parsley, basil, or chives), chopped

recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
3. Heat olive oil in a 10-inch oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
4. Add bell pepper and zucchini. Cook for 4-5 minutes until vegetables are tender.
5. Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 1 minute.
6. Spread vegetables evenly in the skillet. Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables.
7. Sprinkle cherry tomatoes and feta cheese on top.
8. Cook on the stovetop for 3-4 minutes until the edges start to set.
9. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 12-15 minutes until the frittata is set and lightly golden on top.
10. Sprinkle with fresh herbs before serving.
11. Let cool slightly, then slice into wedges and serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.title: Vegetable Curry
recipes.summary: A fragrant and spicy curry packed with vegetables and served with rice. This vegan and gluten-free dish is perfect for a comforting dinner.

extendedIngredients.name: chickpeas
extendedIngredients.original: 1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed

recipes.instructions:
1. Heat coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
3. Add curry powder, turmeric, cumin, coriander, and red pepper flakes. Stir for 30 seconds to toast the spices.
4. Add potatoes, cauliflower, and carrots. Stir to coat with the spices.
5. Add bell pepper, chickpeas, coconut milk, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth. Stir to combine.
6. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low. Cover and cook for 20-25 minutes, until vegetables are tender.
7. Stir in lime juice and season with salt to taste.
8. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve over rice.

recipes.title: Vegetable Fried Rice
recipes.summary: A quick and easy fried rice loaded with vegetables and scrambled eggs. This versatile dish is perfect for using up leftover rice and vegetables.

extendedIngredients.name: rice
extendedIngredients.original: 3 cups cooked and cooled rice (preferably day-old)

extendedIngredients.name: soy sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 3 tbsp low-sodium soy sauce or tamari

recipes.instructions:
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Add beaten eggs and scramble until just cooked, about 1 minute. Remove from wok and set aside.
3. Add remaining tablespoon of oil to the wok. Add garlic and ginger and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
4. Add carrots and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
5. Add peas and corn. Stir-fry for another minute.
6. Add the cooked rice, breaking up any clumps. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until the rice is heated through.
7. Return the scrambled eggs to the wok. Add green onions, soy sauce, sesame oil, and rice vinegar. Stir to combine everything well.
8. Season with black pepper and additional soy sauce if needed.
9. Serve hot, garnished with additional green onions if desired.

recipes.title: Vegetable Lasagna
recipes.summary: Layers of pasta, vegetables, cheese, and tomato sauce baked to perfection. This vegetarian lasagna is hearty, satisfying, and perfect for feeding a crowd.
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
3. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
5. Add zucchini, bell peppers, and mushrooms. Cook for 7-8 minutes until vegetables are tender.
6. Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat.
7. In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, and Italian seasoning.
8. Spread 1 cup of marinara sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
9. Layer 4 lasagna noodles over the sauce, overlapping slightly.
10. Spread 1/3 of the ricotta mixture over the noodles, followed by 1/3 of the vegetable mixture, 1 cup of marinara sauce, and 1 cup of mozzarella cheese.
11. Repeat layers twice more, ending with noodles, sauce, and remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese on top.
12. Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes until cheese is bubbly and golden.
13. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting. Garnish with fresh basil before serving.

recipes.title: Vegetable Soup
recipes.summary: A hearty soup packed with seasonal vegetables and herbs in a flavorful broth. This versatile soup is perfect for using whatever vegetables you have on hand.

extendedIngredients.name: green beans
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup green beans, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces

recipes.instructions:
1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, and celery. Cook for 5 minutes until vegetables begin to soften.
2. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
3. Add potatoes, zucchini, green beans, and cabbage. Stir to combine.
4. Add diced tomatoes with their juice, vegetable broth, bay leaf, thyme, and rosemary.
5. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes until all vegetables are tender.
6. Remove bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper.
7. Stir in fresh parsley and lemon juice just before serving.
8. Serve hot with crusty bread if desired.
